property.name: text
property.value: If phase difference is greater than PI/3 radians, the control output is set to 1. Otherwise, it is zero.

property.name: text
property.value:
This model illustrates a distributed system that monitors relative phases of two power signals and outputs a control signal whenever the phase difference exceeds PI/3 radians. Power grid signals are sampled at 500 samples/second. Platforms 1 and 2 deliver phase values to the Synchrophasor Vector Processor (SVP) every 10 ms.
The first power signal has a constant phase of PI/18 radians. The second signal has the same phase initially, but at t=0.5 s, a phase disturbance occurs.

property.name: description
property.value: Distributed Platform Synchrophasor Application. Monitors relative phases of two power signals and outputs a control signal whenever the phase difference for the two platforms exceeds PI/3 radians.

property.name: text
property.value: This model illustrates the behavior of a synchrophasor vector processor, which calculates the phase difference between the phase values received from the two platforms. Whenever phase difference exceeds PI/3 radians, the control output is set to 1.

svg.text: State machine that produces a control output whenever phase difference exceeds a threshold ( = PI/3 radians).

property.name: text
property.value: Models an unstable phase disturbance pattern in the power grid

property.name: text
property.value: Model of the power grid signals. signal1 and signal2 are two sinusoids at 60 Hz. signal1 has a constant phase and phase of signal2 is modeled as an expanding sinusoidal phase disturbance that occurs at t = 0.5. nom_cos and nom_sin model the 60 Hz phase reference signals and are used to calculate the relative phases of the two power grid signals. All signals are sampled at 500 samples/sec.

svg.text: Until t = 0.5 s, phase output is constant at PI/18. At t= 0.5, a phase disturbance occurs as modeled in the 'disturbance' state.

property.name: text
property.value: This is the PTIDES implementation of the phase-measurement platform. The incoming signals are sampled at 500 samples/sec and the phase output rate is 100 samples/sec.

property.name: text
property.value: This model illustrates the dataflow implementation of a phase-measurement unit. The input signal is multiplied by real and imaginary parts of a complex sinusoid at the same frequency and then filtered. The FIR filter coefficients for this implementation are designed for a sampling rate of 500 samples/second and a cut-off frequency of 30 Hz. IIR filter actors are used in the design to also allow IIR implementations of the same functionality. An arctangent actor is used to calculate the angle between the two filter outputs, which represents the relative phase of the input signal with respect to the reference complex sinusoid.

property.name: text
property.value: This is the PTIDES implementation of the phase-measurement platform. The incoming signals are sampled at 500 samples/sec and the phase output rate is 100 samples/sec.

property.name: text
property.value: This model illustrates the dataflow implementation of a phase-measurement unit. The input signal is multiplied by real and imaginary parts of a complex sinusoid at the same frequency and then filtered. The FIR filter coefficients for this implementation are designed for a sampling rate of 500 samples/second and a cut-off frequency of 30 Hz. IIR filter actors are used in the design to also allow IIR implementations of the same functionality. An arctangent actor is used to calculate the angle between the two filter outputs, which represents the relative phase of the input signal with respect to the reference complex sinusoid.
